intro: Plagiobothrys fulvus var. fulvus, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers bloom in early spring. This species is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
